Bug.Summery: Preference page template does not generate the referenced PreferenceInitializer

Lines.Line: - Used the template extension wizard from the manifest editor to generate a new
preference page.
- It generated not only an extension for the preference page, but also a
preference initializer extension (runtime).
- The referenced preference initializer class (PreferenceInitializer) was not
generated.

Bug.WithStack:
build I20041116
- Used the template extension wizard from the manifest editor to generate a new preference page. - It generated not only an extension for the preference page, but also a preference initializer extension (runtime). - The referenced preference initializer class (PreferenceInitializer) was not generated.
I would expect it to generate all classes referenced by the generated XML. Konrad, tell me it isn't so ;-) Generation of preference initializer extension is triggered by IPluginBase.getSchemaVersion() != null while generation of the class is triggered by PluginModelManager.isOSGiRuntime()
I would think they both need to be true to generate extsnsion and class. I will attach a patch that does it. Created attachment 16058 PreferencePageTemplate.patch looks good. *** Bug 79226 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Fixed. Thanks to Wassim for releasing the patch.
Bug.WithOutStack:
build I20041116
- Used the template extension wizard from the manifest editor to generate a new preference page. - It generated not only an extension for the preference page, but also a preference initializer extension (runtime). - The referenced preference initializer class (PreferenceInitializer) was not generated.
I would expect it to generate all classes referenced by the generated XML. Konrad, tell me it isn't so ;-) Generation of preference initializer extension is triggered by IPluginBase.getSchemaVersion() != null while generation of the class is triggered by PluginModelManager.isOSGiRuntime()
I would think they both need to be true to generate extsnsion and class. I will attach a patch that does it. Created attachment 16058 PreferencePageTemplate.patch looks good. *** Bug 79226 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** Fixed. Thanks to Wassim for releasing the patch.

Bug.Summery: 3.0 preference initializer generated for pre-3.0 plug-in

Lines.Line: - Used the PDE manfest editor's template extension support to generate a
preference page.
- It also generated a preference initializer.
- This is a 3.0 concept, but my plug-in does not have the 3.0 processing
instruction. I'm trying to write a plug-in that is portable between 2.1 and 3.0.

Bug.WithStack:
build I20041116
- Used the PDE manfest editor's template extension support to generate a preference page. - It also generated a preference initializer. - This is a 3.0 concept, but my plug-in does not have the 3.0 processing instruction. I'm trying to write a plug-in that is portable between 2.1 and 3.0.
Ideally, PDE would not generate 3.0 content for pre-3.0 plug-ins. I realize that this is probably tricky to achieve though, requiring maintaining multiple templates. The preference template is the only tricky one. For all other templates, we provide two versions.
Konrad, I'll leave it to you to decide whether we should invest in 2.1 stuff when we're in the 3.1 cycle. Wassim, I have no plan to invest in 2.1 templates, besides ensuring that correct template is used.
Other than this being caused by the same issue as bug 79222, I see it is sometimes possible for schema version being noticed incorrect from template generation code. To reproduce: checkout org.eclipse.help.ui. Open plugin.xml, delete processing instruction using source page, save, add extension - the preference page from the template. The model.getPluginBase().getSchemaVersion() still returns 3.0, and generates wrong code. Creating another preference extension, the schema version is reported correctly.
Nick, Has the plug-in never had the 3.0 processing instruction, or have you deleted the line from the plug-in in the workspace? sounds like we are forgetting to null the schema version field upon your first save. It originally had the 3.0 tag, and I removed it.
Is it possible to update the state incrementally? I wouldn't expect to have to do a save between removing the 3.0 tag and adding a new extension?
Created attachment 16072 AbstractPluginDocumentHandler
It should fix determining the schema version after a change. It will not be necessary to save. Marking as fixed. thanks Konrad.

Konrad, I'll leave it to you to decide whether we should invest in 2.1 stuff when we're in the 3.1 cycle. Wassim, I have no plan to invest in 2.1 templates, besides ensuring that correct template is used.

The model.getPluginBase().getSchemaVersion() still returns 3.0, and generates wrong code. Creating another preference extension, the schema version is reported correctly.

Bug.Summery: Generated preference page should not set preference defaults

Lines.Line: - Generated a preference page using the PDE manifest editor's extension template.
- it generated an initializeDefaults() method like the following, called from
the constructor of the page:

Bug.WithStack:
build I20041116
- Generated a preference page using the PDE manifest editor's extension template. - it generated an initializeDefaults() method like the following, called from the constructor of the page:
/** * Sets the default values of the preferences. */ private void initializeDefaults() { IPreferenceStore store = getPreferenceStore(); store.setDefault(P_BOOLEAN, true); store.setDefault(P_CHOICE, "choice2"); store.setDefault(P_STRING, "Default value"); }
This is setting the default values in the preference store. This is not the responsibility of the preference page, but rather the plugin or its preference initializer. The page should never affect the default values (although it should handle resetting the current values to the defaults). I'm pretty certain the 3.0 template does not set defaults in the constructor of the page.
Is this the 2.1 template, Nick? Although it is certainly not the job of the preference page to set defaults, it's not that simple in 2.1 (ie. prior to the introduction of the preference initializer extension point). The user can choose to create a plugin that has no top-level Java class, what do we do in this case? Also, templates are decoupled and separate entities, having the initializer code in the plugin Java class requires some internal knowledge, etc.
All those problems no longer exist with the new 3.0 preference initializer extension point. I'm pretty sure I tried this from 3.1, since it also tried to generate the preference initializer.
Yes, in 3.1, I still get the initializeDefaults(), and no PreferenceInitializer.
It is caused by same issue as bug 79222 - wrong template used.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 79222 ***

Bug.Summery: Solaris 8 crash
Bug.WithStack:
Eclipse 3.1M3 (but also 3.0.1) will crash, if you change the perspective from java to source and select then a file in the navigator: dlopen ld.so.1: /usr/j2se/jre/bin/java: fatal: relocation error: file /opt/sfw/lib/libXm.so: symbol wmShellClassRec: referenced symbol not found
I've also compiled the version 3.1M3 and there are two warnings: (i) CLabel.java (at line 192) --> methode CLabel.findMnemonic (String) ... (ii) CTabFolder.findMnemonic (String) ... SSQ to verify that this isn't a PI gen problem. We do not have a native for wmShellClassRec, so it cannot be a PI gen problem.
Have you recompiled the SWT native libraries too? What Motif library are you using? Normally, the standard Motif library on Solaris is installed in /usr/dt/lib and not in /usr/sfw/lib. This seems to be a configuration problem in your machine. Hi, thank you for your reply. The problem was, that I've installed in former times gnome and in the LD_LIBRARY_PATH not changed the order (/usr/sfw/lib was in the first place). --> it's NOT a bug !
Bug.WithOutStack:
Eclipse 3.1M3 (but also 3.0.1) will crash, if you change the perspective from java to source and select then a file in the navigator: dlopen ld.so.1: /usr/j2se/jre/bin/java: fatal: relocation error: file /opt/sfw/lib/libXm.so: symbol wmShellClassRec: referenced symbol not found
I've also compiled the version 3.1M3 and there are two warnings: (i) CLabel.java (at line 192) --> methode CLabel.findMnemonic (String) ... (ii) CTabFolder.findMnemonic (String) ... SSQ to verify that this isn't a PI gen problem. We do not have a native for wmShellClassRec, so it cannot be a PI gen problem.
Have you recompiled the SWT native libraries too? What Motif library are you using? Normally, the standard Motif library on Solaris is installed in /usr/dt/lib and not in /usr/sfw/lib. This seems to be a configuration problem in your machine. Hi, thank you for your reply. The problem was, that I've installed in former times gnome and in the LD_LIBRARY_PATH not changed the order (/usr/sfw/lib was in the first place). --> it's NOT a bug !

Bug.Summery: [consistency] Tables treat Space differently

Lines.Line: - run the ControlExample, go to the Table tab
- listen for KeyUp, KeyDown, Selection and DefaultSelection
- give focus to an item in the example Table on the page
- press Space, and the following will be fired:
-> win32 and mac: KeyDown, KeyUp
-> motif: KeyDown, Selection, KeyUp
-> gtk: KeyDown, Selection, DefaultSelection, KeyUp

Bug.WithStack:
- run the ControlExample, go to the Table tab - listen for KeyUp, KeyDown, Selection and DefaultSelection - give focus to an item in the example Table on the page - press Space, and the following will be fired: -> win32 and mac: KeyDown, KeyUp -> motif: KeyDown, Selection, KeyUp -> gtk: KeyDown, Selection, DefaultSelection, KeyUp
My guess here is that the motif behaviour is "correct" since it most closely matches the behaviour of pressing Space on a Tree item. On some platforms and in certain widgets, space doesn't select an item. Need to check the various controls. Grant to prioritize.
Bug.WithOutStack:
- run the ControlExample, go to the Table tab - listen for KeyUp, KeyDown, Selection and DefaultSelection - give focus to an item in the example Table on the page - press Space, and the following will be fired: -> win32 and mac: KeyDown, KeyUp -> motif: KeyDown, Selection, KeyUp -> gtk: KeyDown, Selection, DefaultSelection, KeyUp
My guess here is that the motif behaviour is "correct" since it most closely matches the behaviour of pressing Space on a Tree item. On some platforms and in certain widgets, space doesn't select an item. Need to check the various controls. Grant to prioritize.

Bug.Summery: Rotate a Figure
Bug.WithStack:
Hello,
I have a real problem. I started developing the new Version of an Seatingmap-editor based on GEF 3.1 and the project is nearly complete. But today I realized that neither SWT nor Draw2D supports Rotation of Figures, but this is an essential Feature, as I have to be backwards-compatible to the old File-Format. I thought that this could be done, with the help of the Class org.eclipse.draw2d.geometry.Transform, but I as I saw today this is not the case. Because I think that Rotation is an essential feature in an Graphical Framework, it would be really nice, if this feature could be somehow integrated into the final release of the GEF 3.1.
Thank you very much in advance Daniel Rotation doesn't exist in SWT. You'll have to fake it in your layout manager and figure hierarchy. If you are just drawing primitive shapes, you could write utilities for transforming the different calls.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Hello,
I have a real problem. I started developing the new Version of an Seatingmap-editor based on GEF 3.1 and the project is nearly complete. But today I realized that neither SWT nor Draw2D supports Rotation of Figures, but this is an essential Feature, as I have to be backwards-compatible to the old File-Format. I thought that this could be done, with the help of the Class org.eclipse.draw2d.geometry.Transform, but I as I saw today this is not the case. Because I think that Rotation is an essential feature in an Graphical Framework, it would be really nice, if this feature could be somehow integrated into the final release of the GEF 3.1.
Thank you very much in advance Daniel Rotation doesn't exist in SWT. You'll have to fake it in your layout manager and figure hierarchy. If you are just drawing primitive shapes, you could write utilities for transforming the different calls.

Bug.Summery: Rename class incorrectly renames an inner class
Need to know if -nl parameter was set
Bug.WithStack:
We need to be able to determine if the user set thier locale using the -nl command line parameter or if it was determined by querying the default Locale.
I am happy with a system property (e.g. "osgi.nl.user") if you want to do it that way so as not to change any current behaviour. Given the nature of the initial problem that we are trying to fix, a very low disturbance fix has been implemented.
The osgi.nl.user is set to the osgi.nl value if one of -nl or osgi.nl.user has been specified. The fix is made in EnvironmentInfo.java. How does this handle the case where the user does -Dosgi.nl or puts it in their config.ini file (where I would expect an installer to write it)
Every case is handled in the EnvironmentInfo#setupSystemContext().
This API is not public. The code for the fix is in #setupSystemContext, but the fix itself consists in setting the osgi.nl.user property. See comment #1.
So what public API can I use to get this value? java.lang.System.getProperty("osgi.nl.user")
Bug.WithOutStack:
We need to be able to determine if the user set thier locale using the -nl command line parameter or if it was determined by querying the default Locale.
I am happy with a system property (e.g. "osgi.nl.user") if you want to do it that way so as not to change any current behaviour. Given the nature of the initial problem that we are trying to fix, a very low disturbance fix has been implemented.
The osgi.nl.user is set to the osgi.nl value if one of -nl or osgi.nl.user has been specified. The fix is made in EnvironmentInfo.java. How does this handle the case where the user does -Dosgi.nl or puts it in their config.ini file (where I would expect an installer to write it)
Every case is handled in the EnvironmentInfo#setupSystemContext().
This API is not public. The code for the fix is in #setupSystemContext, but the fix itself consists in setting the osgi.nl.user property. See comment #1.
So what public API can I use to get this value? java.lang.System.getProperty("osgi.nl.user")

Bug.Summery: Generated classes should apply JDT template

Lines.Line: - Used the manifest editor templates to generate a preference page.
- The generated preference page did not have a copyright comment.
- I had customized JDT's templates to have a copyright comment (prefs > Java >
Code Style > Code Templates > Code > New Java Files).

Bug.WithStack:
build I20041116
- Used the manifest editor templates to generate a preference page. - The generated preference page did not have a copyright comment. - I had customized JDT's templates to have a copyright comment (prefs > Java > Code Style > Code Templates > Code > New Java Files).
It would be nice if this template could be applied to files generated by PDE. It would be nice, but not possible currently. As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.
Bug.WithOutStack:
build I20041116
- Used the manifest editor templates to generate a preference page. - The generated preference page did not have a copyright comment. - I had customized JDT's templates to have a copyright comment (prefs > Java > Code Style > Code Templates > Code > New Java Files).
It would be nice if this template could be applied to files generated by PDE. It would be nice, but not possible currently. As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

- listen for KeyUp, KeyDown, Selection and Default Selection
- give focus to an item in the example Tree on the page
- press Space

-> on win32 and motif you'll get KeyDown, Selection, KeyUp

selection, key down, key up

Bug.Summery: provide and consolidate export capabilites from views
Bug.WithStack:
Provide a common UI and extension mechanism for the "Export" action from our views, we will also need to consolidate the existing methods.
The "Export" action should allow the user to export the current selection or the whole content of a view (by choosing a set of columns/properties from the set of available columns/properties) into several formats: XML+XSL,HTML, CVS, SVG or other appropriate format.
The common infrastructure can be provided in TPTP so any view can follow (and leverage) this approach which should be also part of the UI guidelines. Please read CSV instead of CVS. I target this to 4.0 I4. This feature should make use of the dynamic column support, in order to query the column set and to build the result. I will send a note to the requiements group for approval. Retarget since only P1 features are committed to 4.0 Retargeted to 4.1 because it blocks 79118.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 88960 *** Closing this duplicate.

The common infrastructure can be provided in TPTP so any view can follow (and leverage) this approach which should be also part of the UI guidelines. Please read CSV instead of CVS. I target this to 4.0 I4. This feature should make use of the dynamic column support, in order to query the column set and to build the result. I will send a note to the requiements group for approval. Retarget since only P1 features are committed to 4.0 Retargeted to 4.1 because it blocks 79118.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 88960 *** Closing this duplicate.

Bug.Summery: Breakpoint icons should be different for 'not installed' and 'skip all'

Lines.Line: a) not installed yet
b) skipped since the 'Skip all breakpoints' toggle is engaged

Bug.WithStack:
I200411170800
Currently, breakpoint icons in the vertical ruler look the same when they are a) not installed yet b) skipped since the 'Skip all breakpoints' toggle is engaged
The icons should be different for these two cases. About every other week, I am puzzled why my breakpoints are not hit, until I realize that I have 'Skip all breakpoints' active and don't remember it.
Breakpoints could be rendered gray when 'Skip all breakpoints' is active. Gray could be generated out of the blue icon with SWT.IMAGE_GRAY.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 71149 *** We should also probably put up a warning whenever the user creates a new launch in debug mode with the breakpoint manager disabled. Re comment 2: If you do this, then the user should be able to disable the warning. My most common use case for 'Skip All Breakpoints' is to start up without breakpoints and enable them when everything's up & running.
Bug.WithOutStack:
I200411170800
Currently, breakpoint icons in the vertical ruler look the same when they are a) not installed yet b) skipped since the 'Skip all breakpoints' toggle is engaged
The icons should be different for these two cases. About every other week, I am puzzled why my breakpoints are not hit, until I realize that I have 'Skip all breakpoints' active and don't remember it.
Breakpoints could be rendered gray when 'Skip all breakpoints' is active. Gray could be generated out of the blue icon with SWT.IMAGE_GRAY.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 71149 *** We should also probably put up a warning whenever the user creates a new launch in debug mode with the breakpoint manager disabled. Re comment 2: If you do this, then the user should be able to disable the warning. My most common use case for 'Skip All Breakpoints' is to start up without breakpoints and enable them when everything's up & running.

Bug.Summery: The create project wizard creates files as it you progress through the wizard instead of waiting till the wizard finishes.
Bug.WithStack:
The Create project wizard will create the project folder and .project file after hitting next on the first page of the project creation wizard. If you then hit back the project folder and .project file are deleted. This will cause problems with SCM providers since once the files are created, users are prompted to add them to source control. If the user has added files to source control we dont want to then remove them. Could the Create Project wizard run in a workspace operation so resource creation events are delivered after the user has completed all of the steps? The issue here is that it is likely other wizards are relying on that behaviour to determine other things (I can't say for sure as we only supply the base wizard) so changing that behaviour will likely be a breaking change.
The problem with doing a workbench operation is that you will lock the workbench for the duration of the wizard invocation - if someone then does something in a different Thread using the same wizard it could dealock itself.
What is SCM? There might be a solution we can find that is non breaking. SCM stands for "Software Configuration Management". Thus, we could substitute the term "Team providers" in place of "SCM providers" in the original bug description. (In reply to comment #2) > The issue here is that it is likely other wizards are relying on that > behaviour to determine other things (I can't say for sure as we only supply > the base wizard) so changing that behaviour will likely be a breaking change.
I checked this on 3.3.0 and the problem is not with the base wizard or the plug-in project wizard. It is with the java project wizard. Anders, can you confirm this? Were you talking about the java project wizard in comment #0? After testing it does seem that the Java Project is the one with the problem. General/base Projects and feature/plugin projects don't seem to have a problem. I don't honestly remember if in 2004 other projects had a similar problem but since they don't anymore, if we can fix the Java Project creation wizard that would be great. The real problem is in any wizzard that adds files and then removes them. (In reply to comment #5) > After testing it does seem that the Java Project is the one with the problem. > General/base Projects and feature/plugin projects don't seem to have a problem. > I don't honestly remember if in 2004 other projects had a similar problem but > since they don't anymore, if we can fix the Java Project creation wizard that > would be great.
We should probably move this to JDT/UI then. Though, as comment 2 noted, some adopters of JDT may be relying on that behaviour.
> The real problem is in any wizzard that adds files and then removes them.
Well, the Platform team really has no control over this bit, as you can imagine. (In reply to comment #5) > After testing it does seem that the Java Project is the one with the problem.
Is this still an issue? Existing team providers don't seem to have problems with this.

Bug.Summery: TypeCollidesWithPackage not detected in default package
Bug.WithStack:
The error "The type {0} collides with a package" is not detected at the root of the package hierarchy, ie., the compiler accepts a toplevel package and a type in the default package having the same name.
Fix: add to the front of org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.lookup.LookupEnvironment.createPackage
something like: if (compoundName.length == 1) if (defaultPackage.getType0(compoundName[0])!= null) return null; The message will be produced at the calling site. Types in the default package are special. They are only visible to other types in the default package.
Check with javac - they do not report collisions either.
Bug.WithOutStack:
The error "The type {0} collides with a package" is not detected at the root of the package hierarchy, ie., the compiler accepts a toplevel package and a type in the default package having the same name.
Fix: add to the front of org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.lookup.LookupEnvironment.createPackage
something like: if (compoundName.length == 1) if (defaultPackage.getType0(compoundName[0])!= null) return null; The message will be produced at the calling site. Types in the default package are special. They are only visible to other types in the default package.
Check with javac - they do not report collisions either.

Bug.Summery: Command line WSDL Validator does not run WS-I validation
Bug.WithStack:
I am having quite a bit of trouble trying to use either the ant task or the WSDLValidate command line tool along with the WS-I Basic Profile validation. I am using version 1.2.0 of WSVT.
First, I had to grunge through the code to discover that the proper command line to validate for WS-I was this:
-wsiv org.eclipse.wsdl.validate.wsi.bp10.WSIValidator http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/ validatewsi -schemaDir plugins/org.eclipse.wsdl.validate/xsd <path to wsdl>
The syntax of the -wsiv switch was not documented. Actually the whole existence of the command line tool isn't documented. In fact in the CVS code, the syntax has changed for generic external validators. Once I figured that out, I am currently stuck because there does not seem to be any way to define the location of the WS-I test assertion document. There are several APIs to do this, although only one, WSITestToolsProperties.setTADFile(), is used and the only thing that actually calls the setTADFile() API is the eclipse plugin. Looks like there is a missing call in WSDLValidate.java: else if(param.equalsIgnoreCase(WSDLValidate.PARAM_WSIVAL)) { WSDLConfigurator.registerWSIValidator(namespace, validatorClass, propertiesFile, null); NEW WSITestToolsProperties.setTADFile(WSIConstants.DEFAULT_TEST_ASSERTIONS_DOCUMENT_URI);
}
As for the ant task (which is what I actually want to use), I can see no way to configure the WS-I validator class event though WSI validation defaults to WSI_REQUIRE. The registration is missing, so the validation prints the message: [WSDLValidate] WARNING 1:1:There is no WS-I Compliance validator registered for namespace http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/.
Looks like a register and setTADFile() call should be added in ant.WSDLValidate on line 278: // Register WS-I validator WSDLConfigurator.registerWSIValidator("http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/", "org.eclipse.wsdl.validate.wsi.bp10.WSIValidator", "validatewsi", null);
I haven't managed to rebuild with these changes to verify them, which is my next step. I have to download eclipse first...
I checked the CVS source, but I didn't see any indication that the ant task would actually do the WS-I validation there either, although it looks like things have changed a great deal since the last (1.2) release. Changing component to Web Tools -> WSDL The Ant task part of this defect is a duplicate of 66004. I will leave this defect open to deal with the command line UI. Tom, I've cc'ed you on 66004. I'm downgrading the severity of this defect as it is not a mainstream WTP scenario. The WS-I WSDL validator extension has been updated and can now run as part of the command line WSDL validation task. (See bug 66004 for more information about the task.)
To specify the compliance level the WSDLValidate task has been updated to accept properties in the form of -Dname=value. To specify the compliance level one of the following should be set
WS-I validation with the attachments profile http://ws-i.org/profiles/BasicWithAttachments/ComplianceLevel WS-I validation with the simple soap basic profile (SSBP_ http://ws-i.org/profiles/Basic/ComplianceLevel
The following values are defined for each: REQUIRE, SUGGEST, IGNORE.
For example, to specify that WS-I SSBP compliance is required specify -Dhttp://ws-i.org/profiles/Basic/ComplianceLevel=REQUIRE
note: The WS-I WSDL validator currently has dependencies on ICU4J, the WTP WST URI resolution framework and UDDI4J. All of these libraries plus WSDL4J and Xerces (required by the WSDL validator) must be located on the classpath. More work needs to be done to reduce the number of requirements. Released to WTP 1.5RC2. I will mark this as verified just to avoid the Email spam, but I will not that I have not had a chance to test this in any way. OK Tom. I did test this on WTP 1.5. Feel free to reopen if you have a chance/need to use this functionality in the future and find that it is not working as you'd expect.
Closing bug.
Bug.WithOutStack:
I am having quite a bit of trouble trying to use either the ant task or the WSDLValidate command line tool along with the WS-I Basic Profile validation. I am using version 1.2.0 of WSVT.
First, I had to grunge through the code to discover that the proper command line to validate for WS-I was this:

Bug.Summery: ErrorLog View forgets its settings.
Bug.WithStack:
ErrorLog View forgets its settings.
To reproduce: Open ErrorLog view, ensure it is closed in other perspectives. Change some of the view settings, like log filters or column width. Close the view, and reopen. Settings are lost.
The view uses IMemento provided by the workbench to save/restore setting. The settings should rather be kept in the plugin workspace preferences. This can be a small break in Cherie's activities to keep in touch. Don't worry -- I've been putting code in here and there because I miss you all so much ;-)
I'll fix up this one too :) Filter dialog state now saved to plug-in's dialog settings. Other view states (i.e. column widths, sorting order of columns, activate-on-new-events flag) are saved to plug-in preferences.
Fixed and released to head :)
Also of note is that the sort-by-date functionality was not working due to an incompatible date pattern. This has also been fixed.
Bug.WithOutStack:
ErrorLog View forgets its settings.
To reproduce: Open ErrorLog view, ensure it is closed in other perspectives. Change some of the view settings, like log filters or column width. Close the view, and reopen. Settings are lost.
The view uses IMemento provided by the workbench to save/restore setting. The settings should rather be kept in the plugin workspace preferences. This can be a small break in Cherie's activities to keep in touch. Don't worry -- I've been putting code in here and there because I miss you all so much ;-)
I'll fix up this one too :) Filter dialog state now saved to plug-in's dialog settings. Other view states (i.e. column widths, sorting order of columns, activate-on-new-events flag) are saved to plug-in preferences.
Fixed and released to head :)
Also of note is that the sort-by-date functionality was not working due to an incompatible date pattern. This has also been fixed.

Bug.Summery: [formatter] Java Code Formatting results in placement three screens right
Covariance Implementation Problem
Code Assist context toggling

Lines.Line: x.giveInfo(url.

Bug.WithStack:
I would like to toggle 'Show only proposals visible in the invocation context' on and off upon subsequent pushes of ctrl+space.
Sometimes I have methods that take string for example, but the first invocation is going to be a URL, the second would be a String. Example
class X{ void giveInfo(String value); }
X x; URL url;
Step 1 x.giveInfo(url.
At this point only methods of URL which return String are visible, but I need to change to file first.
x.giveInfo(url.getFile()
But I can not see URL.getFile without turning off this feature. but i like to keep it on most of the time. So it would be nice if I could toggle it on and off with each push. Hope I explained it correctly. Move to JDT/UI. This might required a diffent keybinding. I don't know if this is doable. I can't reproduce this and I don't think that's how 'Show only proposals visible in the invocation context' works: It's only about filtering non-visible elements (e.g. package protected, protected or private method or fields). With you example I see 'getFile()' but also getClass(). (You could continue getClass().getName())
Can you clarify? I was under the impression that it was filtering based on the reference type in which the returned object would be put. When I went searching for why I was seeing this, I saw that option in the preferences and assumed that was it. If this is not how that behaves, then perhaps what I saw was a bug, and I'll have to pay close attention next time this happens. I set it to 'WORKSFORME', please reopen it or file a new one if you see the problem again

Bug.Summery: Importing JAR'd plugin is strange
Bug.WithStack:
in 3.1M3
I have Runtime jar'd in my target. I then tried to import it as binary into my workspace. It seemed to work ok except for two things - the resultant project was not marked as binary (the binary filter in the package explorer did not filter it but did filter all the other (non jar'd) plugins that I imported)
- The classes did not seem to show up for consumers. Various plugins that prereq runtime were unable to resolve runtime classes
I deleted the newly imported runtime project and reimported using a non-JAR'd version of the plugin and everything worked as expected
There were no relevant messages in the log. Jeff, can you please attach the JAR in question... Created attachment 16066 JAR'd Runtime plugin
As requested, here is the runtime plugin as a jar. It otherwise seems to function correctly. I can run with it, compile against it, ... Fixed up the problem with the filter.
The problem with the compilation is a JDT/Core problem. Dup of bug 64340.

Bug.Summery: extract generics interface 3.1M3

source_code.code: "public class GenericOutput<K extends Serializable, V extends Serializable> {

Bug.WithStack:
tried to refactor by extracting interface, and failed to produce correct interface.
class was like:
"public class GenericOutput<K extends Serializable, V extends Serializable> { "
and when i extracted interface, i got:
"public class GenericOutput<K extends Serializable, V extends Serializable> implements MyGenericOutput {"
... should have been:
"public class GenericOutput<K extends Serializable, V extends Serializable> implements MyGenericOutput<K extends Serializable, V extends Serializable> {"
thus, generic interface methods in MyGenericOutput immediately threw compiler errors (generics were stripped out, leaving types like 'K', 'V')
thanks!
3.1M3 seems better than 3.1M2... keep up the good work! Move to JDT/UI close this if this is not on the radar Fixed > 20041129

tried to refactor by extracting interface, and failed to produce correct interface.

thanks!

Bug.Summery: autoboxing does not work in combination with downcasting
Enhancements to Memory View
Bug.WithStack:
The following enhancements are to be made to the Memory View:
* Memory View consists of multiple panes. (MemoryViewPane and RenderingViewPane). These view panes are statically managed the Memory View. As a result, new view panes cannot be added to the view easily.
Planned Changes: Make Memory View more dynamic. It should be able to handle new view panes on the fly.
* Memory View cannot host more than one rendering view pane. If there are multiple rendering view panes in the memory view, the behaviour of adding/removing rendering becomes confusing for user. All view panes listen to events from memory rendering manager. When a memory rendering is added, all view panes get the same event and will add the same rendering. As a result, the renderings are duplicated in the view panes.
Planned Changes: Remove IMemroyRenderingListener and the add/remove rendering event mechanism from the memory rendering manager. The rendering manager is responsible for parsing memoryRenderingTypes extension only. A rendering view pane is responsible for managing the life cycle of its memory renderings.
* Enhance IMultipaneMemoryView and IMemoryViewPane API.
Planned Changes: These definitions of these two interfaces need to be refined.
* Need IRenderingViewPane interface to allow actions to add renderings to a rendering view pane. Created attachment 16080 Patch to org.eclipse.debug.ui
Included in this patch: * Implemented IMemoryBlockModelPresentation in DelegatingModelPresentation and LazyModelPresentation. * Removed the hack in MemoryViewTab for getting to a IMemoryBlockModelPresentation * Remove IMemoryRenderingListener and the notifier in MemoryRenderingManager. * Refined IMultipaneMemoryView interface * Added IMemoryViewPane and IRenderingViewPane * Added ViewPaneRenderingMgr for managing renderings in a view pane. * Made memory view more extensible. Applied patch. Marking verified. Will open new bugs as required for API review.

Bug.WithStack:
The following enhancements need to be made to the Plug-in Dependencies view:
1. Show caller/callee relationships 2. Display relationships in table/tree layouts. 3. Add a history toolbar button to easily switch between present and past inputs. Konrad, please address #3 a la JDT's Call Hierarchy view, as without it, the usability of the view is undermined. History menu added to the view. Thanks for committing the code Wassim.
Bug.WithOutStack:
The following enhancements need to be made to the Plug-in Dependencies view:
1. Show caller/callee relationships 2. Display relationships in table/tree layouts. 3. Add a history toolbar button to easily switch between present and past inputs. Konrad, please address #3 a la JDT's Call Hierarchy view, as without it, the usability of the view is undermined. History menu added to the view. Thanks for committing the code Wassim.

Bug.Summery: cvs [no such tag]
Bug.WithStack:
Hi all,
CVS server 1.12.9 on AIX 5. WSAD Version: 5.1.1 Build id: 20031120_1915
When one of our developers tag/branch a version, the same/other developers click on the tag/branch, the [no such tag] appears. However, when we user other cvs client, WinCVS, the tag and branch can be seen
As we cannot check out from tag/branch, it causing quite a problem to us.
Jacinle Created attachment 16059 cvs no such tag Eclipse 2.1.2 does not support the developer release of CVS (1.12.*). Please use the production release (1.11.*). Having said that, the checkout should work. The only reason it would fail is if you were checking out a branch that did not contain any files. Are you sure that the folder you have selected contains files in the branch?
Alse, a workaround would be to check the project out of HEAD and perform a Replace with>Branch and Version.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Hi all,
CVS server 1.12.9 on AIX 5. WSAD Version: 5.1.1 Build id: 20031120_1915
When one of our developers tag/branch a version, the same/other developers click on the tag/branch, the [no such tag] appears. However, when we user other cvs client, WinCVS, the tag and branch can be seen
As we cannot check out from tag/branch, it causing quite a problem to us.
Jacinle Created attachment 16059 cvs no such tag Eclipse 2.1.2 does not support the developer release of CVS (1.12.*). Please use the production release (1.11.*). Having said that, the checkout should work. The only reason it would fail is if you were checking out a branch that did not contain any files. Are you sure that the folder you have selected contains files in the branch?
Alse, a workaround would be to check the project out of HEAD and perform a Replace with>Branch and Version.

Bug.Summery: subclipse sharing wizard problem
Bug.WithStack: Subclipse sharing wizard throws a null exception while trying to import project. Is seems that bug occurs in SharingWizard.java at doesSVNDirectoryExist() and completly makes impossible to import data into subversion repository. svn version is 1.1 The subclipse plugin is not provided by Eclipse.org. You should contact the plugin providers (I believe it is a SourceForge project).
Bug.WithOutStack: Subclipse sharing wizard throws a null exception while trying to import project. Is seems that bug occurs in SharingWizard.java at doesSVNDirectoryExist() and completly makes impossible to import data into subversion repository. svn version is 1.1 The subclipse plugin is not provided by Eclipse.org. You should contact the plugin providers (I believe it is a SourceForge project).

Bug.Summery: Readability on main page
Bug.WithStack:
Every item on http://eclipse.org/webtools/main.html in the 'About section' starts with 'The Eclipse Web Tools Platform' ... I think it would enhance readability if theat prefix would be cut (it's not needed anyway, the headline says it already). Good point Leif. I've made the corresponding change to the WTP main page. This change is a bulk update of all _un_targeted, fixed, resolved bugs upon release of M5. This particular bug _might_ have been fixed earlier than M5. (Feel free to correct).
Closing bug. Thanks for verifying.

Bug.Summery: Handling out of sync resources in file search

Lines.Line: 1) modify some text files outside of the workspace
2) execute Search>File
- also shows error dialog
- other files are searched i.e. the errors are collected
- no refresh option

Bug.WithStack:
(observed the confusion of a user when running into the following situation) 1) modify some text files outside of the workspace 2) execute Search>File
An Error Dialog with "Problems encountered during search" shows up.
We need to handle this situation more gracefully: * provide the user with information for how to avoid the problem * offer to refresh the out of sync files (in 3.1 you can contribute a button to the Problems dialog) Quickly looked at old search: - also shows error dialog - other files are searched i.e. the errors are collected - no refresh option
other files are now searched and the error dialog in the end lists the files with problems (in 20050405)
Bug.WithOutStack:
(observed the confusion of a user when running into the following situation) 1) modify some text files outside of the workspace 2) execute Search>File
An Error Dialog with "Problems encountered during search" shows up.
We need to handle this situation more gracefully: * provide the user with information for how to avoid the problem * offer to refresh the out of sync files (in 3.1 you can contribute a button to the Problems dialog) Quickly looked at old search: - also shows error dialog - other files are searched i.e. the errors are collected - no refresh option
other files are now searched and the error dialog in the end lists the files with problems (in 20050405)

Bug.Summery: [Markers] JSP error marks don't vanish
Bug.WithStack:
I tested the lomboz plugin and wasn't satisfied with the JSP editor so i deinstalled it again (deleted all files/directories in the plugins directory). However, no matter what editor i use (e.g. the simple text editor), earlier compiler errors are displayed in the editor and the package explorer (and the problems view). No matter if the errors still exist or not. I haven't found a way to "clean up" these faulty error marks...? Can you try if 'Project->Clean' does the job? If not, platform should automatically delete markers of not present plugins or at least allow to remove them (e.g in the problems view) Of course, that was part of my attempts to make them go away (close/open project, clean project, restart Eclipse, restart Computer, ...). The error messages are simply false, e.g.
"PayScaleBean.PROP_CODE cannot be resolved"
but I already changed the code so there is no constant PayScaleBean.PROP_CODE anymore anywhere in my class and in my JSP page. BTW: I also hoped to remove them in the problems view, but the "Delete" Popup menu item is ghosted (i.e. not selectable). Moving to platform. There must be a way to remove markers generated by either buggy or uninstalled plugins We do not provide a way to clear incorrectly created markers currently.
There are currently no plans to work on this feature As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.
Bug.WithOutStack:
I tested the lomboz plugin and wasn't satisfied with the JSP editor so i deinstalled it again (deleted all files/directories in the plugins directory). However, no matter what editor i use (e.g. the simple text editor), earlier compiler errors are displayed in the editor and the package explorer (and the problems view). No matter if the errors still exist or not. I haven't found a way to "clean up" these faulty error marks...? Can you try if 'Project->Clean' does the job? If not, platform should automatically delete markers of not present plugins or at least allow to remove them (e.g in the problems view) Of course, that was part of my attempts to make them go away (close/open project, clean project, restart Eclipse, restart Computer, ...). The error messages are simply false, e.g.
"PayScaleBean.PROP_CODE cannot be resolved"
but I already changed the code so there is no constant PayScaleBean.PROP_CODE anymore anywhere in my class and in my JSP page. BTW: I also hoped to remove them in the problems view, but the "Delete" Popup menu item is ghosted (i.e. not selectable). Moving to platform. There must be a way to remove markers generated by either buggy or uninstalled plugins We do not provide a way to clear incorrectly created markers currently.
There are currently no plans to work on this feature As of now 'LATER' and 'REMIND' resolutions are no longer supported. Please reopen this bug if it is still valid for you.

I could not reproduce. I fixed the possible class cast exception. Code is released. Reopen if you see it again. Bug was to cast an AbstractMethodDeclaration into an AnnotationMethodDeclaration if it was not an instanceof MethodDeclaration (when computing the return type). This would always cause a ClassCastException for Clinit and ConstructorDeclaration.
Verified (in I20041214-2000) that the fix consists in returning null for the return type of Clinit and ConstructorDeclaration.
Bug.WithOutStack:
200411170800 + jdt.core & ui from HEAD
Found this in the log of my run-time workbench. Sorry, no steps.
Error 2004-11-23 10:28:01.892 Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.core.runtime".
I will investigate. I could not reproduce. I fixed the possible class cast exception. Code is released. Reopen if you see it again. Bug was to cast an AbstractMethodDeclaration into an AnnotationMethodDeclaration if it was not an instanceof MethodDeclaration (when computing the return type). This would always cause a ClassCastException for Clinit and ConstructorDeclaration.
Verified (in I20041214-2000) that the fix consists in returning null for the return type of Clinit and ConstructorDeclaration.

Bug.Summery: formatting of single line Java comments breaks directives for Clover
New form-based compiler prefs: can't scroll with mouse wheel

Lines.Line: 1) In general, scroll bars can't take focus when they are clicked on because
this would take focus away from the client area. Imagine a text editor that
did this. SWT can't do this for free.
2) Clicking in a composite that has children can't assign focus to a child.
Imagine a dialog with OK and CANCEL buttons and the user accidently clicks on
the background composite. Focus should not change in this case. So SWT
shouldn't do anything here either.

Bug.WithStack:
I200411230800
New form-based compiler prefs: can't scroll with mouse wheel. Moving to SWT for advice: Open Preferences - Java - Compiler - Error and Warnings in I20041123
I'm using a ScrolledComposite (in fact a SharedScrolledComposite from ui.forms) in the preference settings area. Normally the tree on the left has the focus so the scrollwheel scrolls the tree.
To get the wheel working on the right side you have to give a focus to one of the widgets inside the scrolled composite. This is not so easy as it either involves using the TAB keys, or by carful clicking without changing setting at the same time. But e.g. clicking on the scollbar doesn't, same for just clicking somewhere at an empty space in the composite: Focus stays on the tree on the left.
I guess what the user expects is that clicking on the scollbar or somwhere else in the composite would allow hime to scroll. But the dialog is clearly something different than views that have clear focus. I found adding the following snipped gave me a expected behaviour. addListener(SWT.Activate, new Listener() { public void handleEvent(Event event) { if (event.type == SWT.Activate) { forceFocus(); } } }); Is that a good idea? Should all scrolled composited in dialog implement something like that?
(listener was added to my extension of ScrolledComposite) FH, it seems that no composite has focus inside the hiearchy. Is this true? What does the operating system do in this case? Steve says:
1) In general, scroll bars can't take focus when they are clicked on because this would take focus away from the client area. Imagine a text editor that did this. SWT can't do this for free.
2) Clicking in a composite that has children can't assign focus to a child. Imagine a dialog with OK and CANCEL buttons and the user accidently clicks on the background composite. Focus should not change in this case. So SWT shouldn't do anything here either.
I can't imagine a case where the application should resassign focus when a scroll bar is clicked.
Are you asking for the mouse wheel to scroll that widget that is under the cursor? I checked some window dialogs and see that they all behave as you specified. Clicking on scrollbars does not change any focus. Ok to close
The answer to the bug is: To scroll the settings, a child needs focus.

Bug.Summery: New form-based compiler prefs usability: takes longer to find and change a setting

Lines.Line: 1. Keep the collapsable sections, since the reason why they are there is
pretty valid.
2. Allow a maximum of one section to be expanded at one time. This will
reduce and even eliminate the scrolling in most cases.
3. When grouping, try not to have groups that only have one item (e.g. String
externalization)

Bug.WithStack:
I200411230800
I played with the new form-based compiler prefs and found it harder to use because not all settings are visible: I have to scroll down to see them. More user interaction is involved. Agree. And with tabs, you know at a glance what other categories are available. Maybe links on the top to focus faster on the setting? Or have all nodes collapsed (I think that give much more clicking work)
Tabs have advantages, I agree, but they don't scale. 4 tabs is the maximum and Philippe is adding more and more options. > Tabs have advantages, I agree, but they don't scale. 4 tabs is the maximum [..]
Yeah, but a scrolling list also doesn't scale. Having 7 tabs is still way more convenient than a huge scrolling list.
Initially collapsing categories sounds like a bad idea. This would in essence start a new tree inside the preference page. If that's the intention, then the additional tree level should rather be added to the main preference pages tree. On level more io the right is not a good idea, 7 tabs neither I almost fell out of my chair when I saw the new compilers preference page.
Now that I regained consciousness and gave the new page a fair chance, here is my take on it:
Too many tabs is a real issue, but so is scrolling. Too much scrolling is much worse than too many tabs though.
If I may be the voice of reason :-), I suggest a compromise: 1. Keep the collapsable sections, since the reason why they are there is pretty valid. 2. Allow a maximum of one section to be expanded at one time. This will reduce and even eliminate the scrolling in most cases. 3. When grouping, try not to have groups that only have one item (e.g. String externalization)
Markus, would you like to rebutt? :-) Wassim's comment 5 sounds good, and I don't want to rebutt (neither to rebut - I had to look up that word ;-). Sorry about the extra 't' :-) Another good word that I have been using a lot this week is 'filibuster': http://dictionary.reference.com/search?r=2&q=filibuster Changed to only show a section a time and broke up large sections-> (almost) no scrolling (depends on the chosen font)
> 20041128 much better now certainly better, but too jumpy (when used the way I use it - i.e. when I don't collapse expanded sections manually).
For example, with the first section expanded, go to the last section and expand it. The first one will now collapse and everything will jump quite a bit and then the last section expands.
Bug.WithOutStack:
I200411230800

Bug.Summery: [search] Refactoring of static generic member fails partially
Program API does not work with GNOME 2.8 (libgnomevfs-WARNING)

Lines.Line: 1. The warnings are not accurate. We are not trying to modify the database.
This seems to be a bug in libgnomevfs.
2. The major change in gnomevfs is that they now use the xdgmime system as
a back-end.
3. This system makes it difficult to support the old libgnomevfs
API which we use. Therefore, most, if not all, of the GNOME code in
Program.java will need to be rewritten.
4. Much of the API we will need to use has only been around since GNOME 2.4.
5. Some of the Program API may be unimplementable with the new API without
changes upstream, specifically listing all known programs and listing all
known file extensions.
Billy, I guess I am just re-stating the obvious, but... while our supported
systems do not include FC3 or (AFAIK) any other system using 2.8, it is a
"major" issue that eclipse does not support launching external apps on any of these.
- I use gnome_url_open() to implement Program.launch(). This API has existed
since GNOME 2.2, and it's much simpler than the original code. This makes
"Open With > System Editor" work properly in Eclipse.
- I use gnome_vfs_mime_type_from_name() to implement findProgram(), which
avoids actually querying the MIME database. This API has existed since at
least GNOME 1.4, and so it is also safe. This allows for getting icons and
program names.

Bug.WithStack:
I200411170800-gtk
Not sure what triggers it, neither who is doing it. I get the following stderr output once in a while:
(<unknown>:27693): libgnomevfs-WARNING **: Deprecated function. User modifications to the MIME database are no longer supported.
In my development workbench, the output reads:
(Gecko:11501): libgnomevfs-WARNING **: Deprecated function. User modifications to the MIME database are no longer supported.
So I suspect the mozilla/gecko library is doing this, hence I punted it to SWT. Probably nothing we can do much about, but here's the bug anyway. Tom: which Linux distribution are you using? fedora core 3 - and now you mention it: the warnings have just started to show up after upgrading from core 2.
$ rpm -q libgnome gnome-vfs gnome-vfs2 libgnome-2.8.0-2 gnome-vfs-1.0.5-21 gnome-vfs2-2.8.2-8
GNOME has recently been revamping their MIME system. There is likely some change which is affecting how we use it. This results in not finding any platform mime handlers, including the system browser, any more.
Program.findProgram(..., "html") won't find anything due to seeing an empty mime database. *** Bug 72110 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** *** Bug 83585 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** I recently discussed the state of the Program API implementation on GNOME with Marco Pesenti Gritti, one of the libgnomevfs maintainers. Here are some of my thoughts:
1. The warnings are not accurate. We are not trying to modify the database. This seems to be a bug in libgnomevfs. 2. The major change in gnomevfs is that they now use the xdgmime system as a back-end. 3. This system makes it difficult to support the old libgnomevfs API which we use. Therefore, most, if not all, of the GNOME code in Program.java will need to be rewritten. 4. Much of the API we will need to use has only been around since GNOME 2.4. 5. Some of the Program API may be unimplementable with the new API without changes upstream, specifically listing all known programs and listing all known file extensions. Billy, I guess I am just re-stating the obvious, but... while our supported systems do not include FC3 or (AFAIK) any other system using 2.8, it is a "major" issue that eclipse does not support launching external apps on any of these.
Do you think that this will make it on the 3.1 plan, given the facts you outlined in comment 7? *** Bug 88042 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** For what it's worth, I get this too using a Debian variant (SimplyMEPIS).
(<unknown>:30919): libgnomevfs-WARNING **: Deprecated function. User modifications to the MIME database are no longer supported.
KDE 3.3.2, Linux kernel 2.6.7
installed deb packages: libgnomevfs2-0, version 2.8.3-11 libgnomevfs2-common, version 2.8.3-11 libgnome2-0, version 2.8.1-2 libgnome2-common, version 2.8.1-2
Created attachment 20490 Patch
On platform-swt-dev, Ty C was interested in helping with this bug. Here are my current hacks that I hope to get in soon:
- I use gnome_url_open() to implement Program.launch(). This API has existed since GNOME 2.2, and it's much simpler than the original code. This makes "Open With > System Editor" work properly in Eclipse. - I use gnome_vfs_mime_type_from_name() to implement findProgram(), which avoids actually querying the MIME database. This API has existed since at least GNOME 1.4, and so it is also safe. This allows for getting icons and program names.
Program.execute() can be implemented on newer GNOME versions using gnome_vfs_mime_application_launch(), but this API is new in GNOME 2.4, and currently gnome-vfs provides no clean way to do runtime version checks like GTK+ does. This makes it a little more complicated, so I haven't done that yet. Once Program.execute() works, only getPrograms() and getExtensions() will be left unfinished, and I believe they may not be possible to implement with the new gnome-vfs API. I did not have much success with gnome_url_open() on RHEL3 or RH9, so I guess this code will need version checks as well. Created attachment 20615 Adds static icon retrieval methods to Mac OS X Carbon variant
The patch primarily enhances Program.java. A caller may use the 2 new static methods to retrieve an icon either by file name extension or by requesting the system folder icon. Created attachment 20616 Adds static icon retrieval methods to Linux GTK variant
The patch primarily enhances Program.java. A caller may use the 2 new static methods to retrieve an icon either by file name extension or by requesting the system folder icon.
The patch uses the same method to get the MIME type as the first patch attached to this bug, but uses GTK functions instead of GNOME ones which are deprecated. Ty, can you open a new bug with your patch? I'd rather keep this one just about the GTK+ implementation. Thanks. First about the GTK+ patch, thanks a lot for posting your code! There are really two parts to it: one is the update to use the new GNOME 2.8 API, and the other part is the addition of the new API. Please file a new bug about the API additions. In this bug I'm addressing the deprecated API use and what to do about it.
The real difference between your solution from my patches is the use of GtkIconTheme versus GnomeIconTheme. I think I'm going to stick with using the GnomeIconTheme code because it still works on newer systems, and is backwards compatible to GNOME 2.2. One change I did make (see bug 92505) was to only create a GNOME icon theme once, rather than each time we do a lookup. This is much more efficient, especially on newer GNOME systems. Having a separate helper to lookup the MIME type per extension is a good idea as well. Fixed > 20050503
The only parts of the Program API which are not implemented on GNOME 2.4 and higher are getPrograms() and getExtensions(), both of which cannot be implemented with the new libgnome-vfs API. There will be no more warnings printed to the console while running Eclipse. *** Bug 78910 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** We created a new bug entry as per comment #15. Please refer to bug #93606. Verified that we work on GNOME 2.8 using I20050510-0010

Bug.Summery: Binary Compatibility sometimes broken ?...
Unhandled NullPointerException in BendpointEditPolicy
Bug.WithStack: In createHandlesForUserBendpoint() of BendpointEditPolicy, the List bendPoints can be null. See return value of getRoutingConstaint(). But it is not check whether the List is null before checking bendPoints.isEmpty() in line 83. BendpointEditPolicy has additional requirements not imposed by getRoutingConstraint() API. Note that Object can be returned, but a List is required for this policy. Fixed and released to HEAD.
Bug.WithOutStack: In createHandlesForUserBendpoint() of BendpointEditPolicy, the List bendPoints can be null. See return value of getRoutingConstaint(). But it is not check whether the List is null before checking bendPoints.isEmpty() in line 83. BendpointEditPolicy has additional requirements not imposed by getRoutingConstraint() API. Note that Object can be returned, but a List is required for this policy. Fixed and released to HEAD.

Bug.Summery: ITypeBinding#isEqualTo(..) returns true when comparing ArrayList<Integer> to its erasure
Bug.WithStack:
I20041117-0800 + jdt.core & ui as for I20041123-0800
ITypeBinding#isEqualTo(..) returns true when comparing ArrayList<Integer> to its erasure. Expected: false. I was just comparing the compoundNames for reference bindings. I added extra checks. Fixed and released in HEAD. Regression test added in ASTConverter15Test.test0075. Verified (in I200412140800) that the test ensures that the binding and its erasure are not isEqualTo(...)

Fixed and released in HEAD. Regression test added in ASTConverter15Test.test0075. Verified (in I200412140800) that the test ensures that the binding and its erasure are not isEqualTo(...)

Bug.Summery: GenClass's Label Feature is not preserved during reload
eclipse hangs for a long time under certain conditions
Bug.WithStack:
eclipse hangs for a long time when cvs server can be contacted, but doesn't exchange any tcp/ip data on open socket.
btw, this often happens when i tunnel cvs through ssh to a remote server, and use pserver:mandrews@localhost as cvs account in eclipse, but thereafter tunnel goes down due to network conditions or other independent reasons. in this case, local ssh process accepts connection to port 2401, but can not relay it to remote server.... thus, eclipse hangs for several minutes with no GUI interactivity. I have tried to reproduce this by placing a breakpoint at the spot where we make the connection and trying several commands. I have not been able to get into a situation where the UI is unresponsive. What operation did you perform to make the UI unresponsive? Our usual practice is to move bugs to the RESOLVED REMIND state when there is not enough information provided to address the reported issue and more information has been requested. This bug has been in the RESOLVED REMIND state for quite some time so it is being CLOSED. If you can provide the requested information or you otherwise feel that this is still an issue, please reopen the bug. If you are unable to open it due to a lack or permissions, please add a comment to the bug stating that you would like to have the request reconsidered. I applogize for this blanket approach to bug screening but there are just to many bugs in the REMIND state for us to effectively triage them. Your help in this matter is appreciated. [REMIND->INVALID] The "REMIND" bugzilla resolution is being removed so reopening to mark as INVALID. INVALID. Closing.

Bug.Summery: Revision History Does not use associated binary editor

Lines.Line: 1. Create a MS Word document (or any binary file)
2. Add the documnet to the CVS.
3. Commit
4. Edit the document
5. Commit
6. Look at the revision history for the document.
7. Double click either the first or second revision.

Bug.WithStack:
When reviewing binary files in the SVN or CVS revision history view, it does not open the associated editor. Instead it dumps the binary contents of the revision to a text view.
Steps:
1. Create a MS Word document (or any binary file) 2. Add the documnet to the CVS. 3. Commit 4. Edit the document 5. Commit 6. Look at the revision history for the document. 7. Double click either the first or second revision.
The binary contents are dumped instead to a text view instead of opening MS Word inside of Eclipse.
Instead it should open the revision in the associated editor.
Normally when working with MS Word documents (e.g. for specifications) in Eclipse it uses the associated editor.
Thanks, Eric
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 37255 ***
Bug.WithOutStack:
When reviewing binary files in the SVN or CVS revision history view, it does not open the associated editor. Instead it dumps the binary contents of the revision to a text view.
Steps:
1. Create a MS Word document (or any binary file) 2. Add the documnet to the CVS. 3. Commit 4. Edit the document 5. Commit 6. Look at the revision history for the document. 7. Double click either the first or second revision.
The binary contents are dumped instead to a text view instead of opening MS Word inside of Eclipse.
Instead it should open the revision in the associated editor.
Normally when working with MS Word documents (e.g. for specifications) in Eclipse it uses the associated editor.
Thanks, Eric
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 37255 ***

Bug.Summery: [Viewers] TableViewer - VirtualManager lacks support for the clear/remove
Bug.WithStack:
There exists no support in the TableViewer for the clear operation in Table. If the table doesn't use SWT.VIRTUAL, this could (maybe) be worked around by calling remove-insert ..
However, when using the virtual option, TableViewer's remove does not update the VirtualManager which can cause anything from the wrong object being shown (removing chances indeces) to null error being thrown.
Using clear directly on the Table will of course cause a null pointer error since item.cached is reset, next time the table needs to display the item VirtualManager fails to locate the item in its hash.
Marcel Tod, someone from SWT who understands both SWT and JFace should review the design of the JFace virtual table viewer sometime soon before 3.1. How about me and Vikki? That would be a good idea Steve. The main issue we are going to have is people who play directly with the Table API like this example here.
We have to decide if we want to have some sort of callback mechanism in place or tell them just to use what is supplied in TableViewer.
Marcel you can do the same thing by calling refresh on the viewer and updating your content provider without this issue but Steve and Vikki should look at my implementation so that they can see what the issues are. Refresh would get the new data displayed (assuming clear isn't called), but this solution doesn't apply to my needs. The fact that an item is kept for each of the table's lines is already a problem, clearing the data might slightly improve that ...
My problem is deeper than that. I have a HUGE amount of data to display, could be millions of lines. It is impractical to even create it all even ignoring the memory explosion problem. The idea is to use a virtual table, a table that asks for an item whenever it needs it. The Table as is could probably be used this way by clearing data that's not displayed at the moment (could keep a cache of a certain size for efficiency if user does PgUp-PgDown).
The TableViewer assumes too many things about the data especially small data size. The TableViewer should act pretty much like Swing's JTable with model & renderer. Unless the user specifies he wants the data to be cached, no caching should be done. Caching items increases the memory utilization needlessly, the user can control better if to re-generate data if needed of cache it.
I've mentioned before, as well as others, that the contents provider model should have a getValueAt(row, col) or at least a getUserItem(row). The VirtualManager (from what I'm understood from its code) only defers the creation of TableItem.
The defence of the current TableViewer design has been (correct me if I'm wrong) that if you want to support filtering/sorting this is a must. The contents modal should be responsible for these. It should be able to decide if filtering/sorting is supported and how will this be done on the data. The viewer should only get data and display it.
Marcel
P.S. - I will revert to v3.0 for now since there I can (in a twisted way) get almost the needed behavior.
Marcel see Bug 60117 for the discussion on deferred content providers. We don't have a released solution for this yet. I an equal problem like marcel. (Eclipse M4) I use a TableViewer with the virtual flag. Initially it is empty. Then data are loaded in the table (e.g. one row). After a user interaction the table is cleared through advising the contentprovider to return an array with a length of 0.
This works great. But when I set new datarows again (e.g. 1 row) in the empty table an Index out of bounds exception occurs:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Index out of bounds at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2813) at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2752) at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2723) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:388) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Table.getItem(Table.java:1232) at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TableViewer.getCreatedItems(TableViewer.java:383) at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TableViewer.internalRefresh(TableViewer.java:728) at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TableViewer.internalRefresh(TableViewer.java:706)
I analysed the problem and it is the following: The currentVisibleIndex is only changed in the "setData" - listener attached in addTableListener() in the TableViewer class. This listener is activated if a new row is added in the model, but it is not notificated when the table is "cleared". So on the next internalRefresh the getCreatedItems() table tries to get the item at the first index of the table, but the table is empty. Todd, we must have someone from SWT look at what you are doing. Keeping a current visible index sounds completely wrong to me. I agree - I think we should work on this together and I think I might have a better solution but I want to bounce it off of you. Upping priority. Steve has some ideas for this sort of thing we may address in 3.2. Steve, do you remember what ideas Tod is referring to? From memory and this bug report, Tod was attempting to keep a "currentVisibleIndex". In general, this doesn't make sense. The operating system can ask for the contents of any item at any time, even those that are not visible. We need to determine what problem "currentVisibleIndex" is solving and see whether the problem is real and/or if there is already a solution in SWT. There is no "currentVisibleIndex" kept by TableViewer. Regarding the original problem (lacking support for clear/remove), there is a method TableViewer.clear(), and TableViewer.remove(int index) is missing.
Marcel/Martin: Is this still a problem for you? Removing the target milestone. Please add a comment if you need index-based remove. Personally, I've worked around this problem by extending the existing class. I do think that TableViewer should have a remove method and any other mehtod that can be directly accessed in Table, even if it is for soundness only. Hitesh is now responsible for watching bugs in the [Viewers] component area.

Bug.Summery: Selfencapsulate Field does not support annotations [refactoring]
Bug.WithStack:
I20041117:
Create annotation:
public @interface Annotation { int property; }
Invoke sef refactoring on "property" -> property is private (illegal modifier in annotations) and accessor is static and has method body.
Apart from generating an accessor, sef is not of much value for annotations, so we might disable it. Fixed for M4. Disabled SEF for fields in annotations since a getter in an annotation isn't valid anyways.
Bug.WithOutStack:
I20041117:
Create annotation:
public @interface Annotation { int property; }
Invoke sef refactoring on "property" -> property is private (illegal modifier in annotations) and accessor is static and has method body.
Apart from generating an accessor, sef is not of much value for annotations, so we might disable it. Fixed for M4. Disabled SEF for fields in annotations since a getter in an annotation isn't valid anyways.

Bug.Summery: Extract Interface should be disabled on annotations [refactoring]
Bug.WithStack: Title says it all... Fixed > 20041206
Bug.WithOutStack: Title says it all... Fixed > 20041206

Bug.Summery: please don't ignore .so files! SWT breaks the build...
Bug.WithStack:
Please don't exclude .so from CVS by default. Or provide a simple mean to persist that preference in the project itself (e.g org.eclipse.swt fragments tell they don't want .so to be excluded.
It is easy on the machines regularly used for SWT builds to change the CVS preferences. But when we work on new platforms or new workspaces, we sometimes forget to do so and break the build: the old swt-3112.so are correctly removed by CVS, and the new ones swt-3113.so are ignored.
Thanks!
More background below. Veronika,
The default settings are those used by CVS (i.e. if you committed using the CVS command line, so files would be ignored and DLLs would not). Could you enter a bug report for this? I am hesitant to change the global ignore since it is consistent with CVS and may affect other users. A better solution would be to support project level settings that are persisted with the project in the repository. We could disable the global setting temporarily until the project settings are supported. Of course, nothing will happen unless we have a bug report;-)
Michael
Veronika Irvine/Ottawa/IBM 23/11/2004 08:46 AM To Michael Valenta/Ottawa/IBM@IBMCA cc Christophe Cornu/Ottawa/IBM@IBMCA Subject Team request
Hi Michael,
SWT broke the Integration build this morning because we forgot to release the libraries on Solaris. The reason we forgot to do this is because *.so files are ignored by default in the Team -> Ignored Resources list. I do not understand why *.so files are ignored but *.dll files are not.
Could you please remove *.so, *.a and *.exec from the list of default ignored files? Since we often need to compile our libraries in a brand new workspace, it is a real problem to have these ignored by default.
Thank you, Veronika I have disable the *.so ignore (so .so files should now show up in CVS operations)

Bug.Summery: Namespace alias doesn't show up in Outline view
Bug.WithStack:
In the following snippet of a cpp file, the Foo namespace is shown in the outline view, but not the Bar namespace.
namespace Foo{} namespace Bar = Foo; The parser recognizes and constructs AST constructs for namespace aliases. Moving to core-inbox as this is a model builder issue, if anyone wants to do it. Future means you commit to fix it in the Future. Inboxes can't make committments. Moving to '--'.
Bug.WithOutStack:
In the following snippet of a cpp file, the Foo namespace is shown in the outline view, but not the Bar namespace.
namespace Foo{} namespace Bar = Foo; The parser recognizes and constructs AST constructs for namespace aliases. Moving to core-inbox as this is a model builder issue, if anyone wants to do it. Future means you commit to fix it in the Future. Inboxes can't make committments. Moving to '--'.

Bug.Summery: [Parser] Namespace alias is not refactored.
Bug.WithStack:
Related to 79281 (outline view), but perhaps a different kind of parse, is a refactor->rename problem where the namespace alias is not renamed when the original namespace is renamed.
namespace Foo{} //rename Foo to Boo namespace Bar = Foo; //but Foo on this line isn't renamed. Must be a cross-reference thing. This works now.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Related to 79281 (outline view), but perhaps a different kind of parse, is a refactor->rename problem where the namespace alias is not renamed when the original namespace is renamed.
namespace Foo{} //rename Foo to Boo namespace Bar = Foo; //but Foo on this line isn't renamed. Must be a cross-reference thing. This works now.

Bug.Summery: Show crosscutting in Visualiser based on concrete aspects
Bug.WithStack:
Related to bug 78615, this is about what to show in the Visualiser - just the concrete aspects?
Background info from the other bug:
Currently AJDT shows cross-cutting based on the aspect that defines the advice (which may be abstract) rather than the (concrete) aspect that implements it. This is misleading. The attached projects show 2 examples where this is problematic.
Example 1:
Project1 defines an abstract aspect which is extended and made concrete in Project2. The Editor view for project2.HelloWorld attributes cross-cutting to the abstract aspect but neither the Outline view for the abstract nor the concrete aspects shows any cross-cutting. The Visualiser views are empty.
Example 2:
Project3 defines an abstract aspect and 2 concrete sub-aspects. All views attribute the cross-cutting of project3.HelloWorld to the abstract aspect and misleadingly hide the duplicate advice in the 2 concrete sub-aspects.
In each example cross-cutting should be attributed to concrete aspects and all concrete aspects should appear in the Visualiser. Not sure I'm going to get round to this so returning to the pool
Bug.WithOutStack:
Related to bug 78615, this is about what to show in the Visualiser - just the concrete aspects?
Background info from the other bug:
Currently AJDT shows cross-cutting based on the aspect that defines the advice (which may be abstract) rather than the (concrete) aspect that implements it. This is misleading. The attached projects show 2 examples where this is problematic.
Example 1:
Project1 defines an abstract aspect which is extended and made concrete in Project2. The Editor view for project2.HelloWorld attributes cross-cutting to the abstract aspect but neither the Outline view for the abstract nor the concrete aspects shows any cross-cutting. The Visualiser views are empty.
Example 2:
Project3 defines an abstract aspect and 2 concrete sub-aspects. All views attribute the cross-cutting of project3.HelloWorld to the abstract aspect and misleadingly hide the duplicate advice in the 2 concrete sub-aspects.
In each example cross-cutting should be attributed to concrete aspects and all concrete aspects should appear in the Visualiser. Not sure I'm going to get round to this so returning to the pool

Bug.Summery: Microsoft Windows event log file import wizard should restrict importing to Windows OS.
Bug.WithStack:
For example, either sense if the current or remote OS is Windows and either enable to disable the Windows event log file selection (e.g. application, system or security). This could be regulated by an OS flag in the org.eclipse.hyades.logging.parsers.logParser extension point. Alternatively, display an error dialog if the user attempts to import a Windows event log from a non-Windows OS. Is this really something we want to do (restrict an import to a specific OS)? From a user's perspective, this seems quite restrictive. I am opening this to track Paul's requirement opened on IIOSB Needs to be discussed first These parsers are only available in a Windows OS. Allowing the user to proceed with the import and recover in a pessimistic manner (e.g. error massage) will solve the problem but may be unfriendly/unproductive.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 79115 *** Closing bug, and setting target to when it was resolved.
