For example, either sense if the current or remote OS is Windows and either enable to disable the Windows event log file selection (e.g. application, system or security). This could be regulated by an OS flag in the org.eclipse.hyades.logging.parsers.logParser extension point. Alternatively, display an error dialog if the user attempts to import a Windows event log from a non-Windows OS. Is this really something we want to do (restrict an import to a specific OS)? From a user's perspective, this seems quite restrictive. I am opening this to track Paul's requirement opened on IIOSB Needs to be discussed first These parsers are only available in a Windows OS. Allowing the user to proceed with the import and recover in a pessimistic manner (e.g. error massage) will solve the problem but may be unfriendly/unproductive.

Bug.WithStack:
Build id: 200411170800
1) start Eclipse on an empty workspace 2) Go to Prefs - Java - Compiler - Unused Code 3) Change 'Unnecessary else statement' to 'Warning' 4) Hit 'Apply' 5) Hit 'Ok' 6) Observe: You are prompted twice to rebuild the workspace, even though 'Ok' doesn't do anything if executed after 'Apply'. 6) Reopen the preference page 7) Observe: The setting for 'Unnecessary else statement' is back to 'Ignore' *** Bug 79285 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** seems to work in I20041124. I made lots of changes on that page during the week, it seems I fixed it. Can you verify that? (please reopen if not) Whow...lots of changes indeed! ;)
I verified that it works for me now.

Bug.Summery: Code assist offers types which are out of scope ==> compile errors

Lines.Line: 1. start fresh workspace
2. import plug-in org.eclipse.jdt.core as Binary project (not linked)
3. create new plug-in project P (enter name, click Next and click Finish)
4. add org.eclipse.jdt.core as pre-req into plugin.xml
5. open PPlugin.java
6. in the constructor code add a third line and type "DefaultL"
7. Ctrl+Space
==> DefaultLineTracker is suggested which is wrong.
8. Select it
==> errors: import cannot be resolved
The JavaSearchScope of the SearchableEnvironment contains not exported entries
of required project.
Created attachment 19867
Fix
Fix released and test added
CompletionTests2#testBug79288
DefaultLineTracker is not offered anymore.
Verified in I20050510-0010 + JDT/Core v_556

Bug.Summery: junit view mixing up test cases
Bug.WithStack:
200411111200
I have been noticing this once in a while: when running Core's test suite, the JUnit view will present one of the test cases that have not been executed yet (e.g.: Foo.testYetToRun()) as "passed"(the green check mark), and will seem to have skipped one of the test cases (e.g. Bar.testAlreadyRun()) in a test suite already run. Double clicking Foo.testYetToRun() on the JUnit view, actually opens Bar.testAlreadyRun() in the Java editor. Double clicking Bar.testAlreadyRun() will open the Java editor on the appropriate file/method.
So it seems the tests are executed properly, by the JUnit view is for some reason getting confused and mixing up totally unrelated test cases. Created attachment 16067 screenshot showing problem
Here, testVariableChanged has not been executed yet, but shows as such. Double clicking it opens a completely unrelated test case (showing in the Java editor). most likely a dup of bug 78618. You're running on J9, right? If not reopen.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 78618 *** Yes, J9 it is.
Bug.WithOutStack:
200411111200

Double clicking Bar.testAlreadyRun() will open the Java editor on the appropriate file/method.

Bug.Summery: Incorrect case when a fully qualified class name is proposed

Lines.Line: - fix pde so the class has the right case.
- fix the wizard so I do not get the unfriendly message.
can't reproduce this in RC7, Wassim?
right Chris. ancient history.

Bug.WithStack:
I200411170800 Create a new project "P" with a plugin class (I kept the default options) You will notice that a package named "p" (notice the lower case). Then, using the editor I create a new application extension. When I create the "run" attribute, the following class name is proposed: "P.PlatformRunnable"
You will notice that the case is invalid (P should be p). This later causes problem when I try to create the class using the "class*" link. Indeed when I click OK in the wizard I get the really unfriendly message "A resource exists with a different case ....".
Two fixes should be done: - fix pde so the class has the right case. - fix the wizard so I do not get the unfriendly message. can't reproduce this in RC7, Wassim? right Chris. ancient history.
Bug.WithOutStack:
I200411170800 Create a new project "P" with a plugin class (I kept the default options) You will notice that a package named "p" (notice the lower case). Then, using the editor I create a new application extension. When I create the "run" attribute, the following class name is proposed: "P.PlatformRunnable"
You will notice that the case is invalid (P should be p). This later causes problem when I try to create the class using the "class*" link. Indeed when I click OK in the wizard I get the really unfriendly message "A resource exists with a different case ....".
Two fixes should be done: - fix pde so the class has the right case. - fix the wizard so I do not get the unfriendly message. can't reproduce this in RC7, Wassim? right Chris. ancient history.

Bug.Summery: Can't drag feature to publish pane

Lines.Line: - new update site project
- add a feature in the workspace to the Feature to Build pane
- try dragging it to the Features to Publish pane
- you get the shortcut cursor, but when you drop, nothing happens

Bug.WithStack:
build I20041116
- new update site project - add a feature in the workspace to the Feature to Build pane - try dragging it to the Features to Publish pane - you get the shortcut cursor, but when you drop, nothing happens
No error dialog, and nothing in the log. this is a pde issue (I think you can dup it against an existing bug) Upping severity as this prevents use of the site editor.
There also needs to be an accessible way of adding selected features to the Publish pane.
Nick, you can copy and paste.
Konrad, we have seen this one before, but were unable to reproduce. If you are able to, please make it go away one way (fixing it) or another (getting rid of the drag and drop altogether). While it's nice to have Copy and Paste work consistently with DnD, I think it would be more obvious here to have >> and << buttons (aka a slush bucket).
Fixed with redesigned site editor. Features are always published. DnD should work better as well.
Bug.WithOutStack:
build I20041116
- new update site project - add a feature in the workspace to the Feature to Build pane - try dragging it to the Features to Publish pane - you get the shortcut cursor, but when you drop, nothing happens
No error dialog, and nothing in the log. this is a pde issue (I think you can dup it against an existing bug) Upping severity as this prevents use of the site editor.
There also needs to be an accessible way of adding selected features to the Publish pane.
Nick, you can copy and paste.
Konrad, we have seen this one before, but were unable to reproduce. If you are able to, please make it go away one way (fixing it) or another (getting rid of the drag and drop altogether). While it's nice to have Copy and Paste work consistently with DnD, I think it would be more obvious here to have >> and << buttons (aka a slush bucket).
Fixed with redesigned site editor. Features are always published. DnD should work better as well.

Bug.WithOutStack:
build I20041116
- In CVS repo view, navigate to HEAD/platform-vcm-home/updates - Open the site.xml file - it fails to open - get the following NPEs in the log: SiteEditor.isDirty (several occurrences) FeatureSection.createClient

The site editor should handle IStorageEditorInput. Alternatively, it should fail early with a PartInitException from its initialize method if the input is not one it accepts.
moving to pde I am pretty sure it used to at some point (I remember adding IStorageInput support for other PDE editors). But since PDE is under new administration, who knows what happened since :-). Fixed.

Bug.Summery: [IProblems][Trilogy] main report for keeping track of Trilogy IProblem bug status
Update site editor: renaming category loses features

Lines.Line: - in the update site editor, define a category and a feature in that category
- rename the category
- the feature is no longer shown in the Features to Publish pane

Bug.WithStack:
build I20041116
- in the update site editor, define a category and a feature in that category - rename the category - the feature is no longer shown in the Features to Publish pane
The workaround is to manually fix up the feature's category in the site.xml pane. moving to PDE
Fixed.

- in the update site editor, define a category and a feature in that category - rename the category - the feature is no longer shown in the Features to Publish pane

Fixed.

Bug.WithStack:
Separate defects have been opened to track down changes in the rest of the Hyades components.
----- Message from Melanie.Woods@scapatech.com on Wed, 27 Oct 2004 17:59:17 +0100 ----- To: hyades-dev@eclipse.org Subject: [hyades-dev] RE: Naming of the Agent Controller/Hyades Data Collection Engine All,
This issue was discussed during the TPTP coordination meeting yesterday and last week's marketing group meeting. The final decision is that the component is to be called the "agent controller".
To summarise the key points of the discussion, the term "data collection" was felt to be too narrow in its scope, as the component will eventually encompass execution as well as collection capabilities. Some concerns regarding the current over-use of the word "agent" were raised, but the majority vote went to the term "agent controller".
Many thanks once again to all who participated in this discussion, and in particular to Nellie for all her help and advice to the marketing group on this matter.
Best regards,
Melanie Created attachment 16069 patch For your convenience I attached a patch containing the fixes I spoke with Joe. He has already applied all of these patches. As of TPTP 4.6.0, TPTP is in maintenance mode and focusing on improving quality by resolving relevant enhancements/defects and increasing test coverage through test creation, automation, Build Verification Tests (BVTs), and expanded run-time execution. As part of the TPTP Bugzilla housecleaning process (see http://wiki.eclipse.org/Bugzilla_Housecleaning_Processes), this enhancement/defect is verified/closed by the Project Lead since this enhancement/defect has been resolved and unverified for more than 1 year and considered to be fixed. If this enhancement/defect is still unresolved and reproducible in the latest TPTP release (http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/), please re-open.

Bug.Summery: [IProblems][Trilogy] #error encountered with text "Endianess not decalred!!"
Bug.WithStack:
Found with the trilogy test:
Severity Description Resource In Folder Location Creation Time 1 C/C++ Indexer Problem: #error encountered with text: Endianess not declared!! in file: C:\cygwin\usr\include\machine\ieeefp.h on line: 266. ieeefp.h cygwin/usr/include/machine line 266 November 23, 2004 10:24:35 AM cause:
ieeefp.h is included somewhere in the Trilogy test:
#ifdef _WIN32 // should be defined but isn't #define __IEEE_LITTLE_ENDIAN #endif
#ifndef __IEEE_BIG_ENDIAN #ifndef __IEEE_LITTLE_ENDIAN #error Endianess not declared!! #endif /* not __IEEE_LITTLE_ENDIAN */ #endif /* not __IEEE_BIG_ENDIAN */ windef.h defines _WIN32 so it should be included in the Trilogy test on windows machines from now on.
Bug.WithOutStack:
Found with the trilogy test:
Severity Description Resource In Folder Location Creation Time 1 C/C++ Indexer Problem: #error encountered with text: Endianess not declared!! in file: C:\cygwin\usr\include\machine\ieeefp.h on line: 266. ieeefp.h cygwin/usr/include/machine line 266 November 23, 2004 10:24:35 AM cause:
ieeefp.h is included somewhere in the Trilogy test:
#ifdef _WIN32 // should be defined but isn't #define __IEEE_LITTLE_ENDIAN #endif
#ifndef __IEEE_BIG_ENDIAN #ifndef __IEEE_LITTLE_ENDIAN #error Endianess not declared!! #endif /* not __IEEE_LITTLE_ENDIAN */ #endif /* not __IEEE_BIG_ENDIAN */ windef.h defines _WIN32 so it should be included in the Trilogy test on windows machines from now on.

Bug.Summery: Rename "Remote Agent Controller" terminology to "Agent Controller"
Bug.WithStack:
Separate defects have been opened to track down changes in the rest of the Hyades components.
----- Message from Melanie.Woods@scapatech.com on Wed, 27 Oct 2004 17:59:17 +0100 ----- To: hyades-dev@eclipse.org Subject: [hyades-dev] RE: Naming of the Agent Controller/Hyades Data Collection Engine All,
This issue was discussed during the TPTP coordination meeting yesterday and last week's marketing group meeting. The final decision is that the component is to be called the "agent controller".
To summarise the key points of the discussion, the term "data collection" was felt to be too narrow in its scope, as the component will eventually encompass execution as well as collection capabilities. Some concerns regarding the current over-use of the word "agent" were raised, but the majority vote went to the term "agent controller".
Many thanks once again to all who participated in this discussion, and in particular to Nellie for all her help and advice to the marketing group on this matter.
Best regards,
Melanie Created attachment 16070 For your convenience I attached a patch containing the fixes There were a lot of plugins in this attachment that were unrelated to test, including trace, logging and probekit stuff. I committed all fo the changes except a couple of problems in these two patches:
org.eclipse.hyades.nls.txt org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.views.nl1.txt
It seems like the patch mechanism in eclipse is not properly handling UTF-8 encoding, as the patch files will not properly apply. I was going to fix these by hand, but I noticed many places in these files where the Agent was referred to as the IBM Remote Agent Controller, and the replacement in the patch file was IBM Agent Controller. I thought it was the case that we do not include IBM in the name either, but since it's the last day to make changes in 3.2i2, I didn't want to guess wrong. Can you please address these two plugins?
Thanks, --Joe The two nl plugins are not required to be updated since they will be regenerated on the next TVT cycle. As of TPTP 4.6.0, TPTP is in maintenance mode and focusing on improving quality by resolving relevant enhancements/defects and increasing test coverage through test creation, automation, Build Verification Tests (BVTs), and expanded run-time execution. As part of the TPTP Bugzilla housecleaning process (see http://wiki.eclipse.org/Bugzilla_Housecleaning_Processes), this enhancement/defect is verified/closed by the Project Lead since this enhancement/defect has been resolved and unverified for more than 1 year and considered to be fixed. If this enhancement/defect is still unresolved and reproducible in the latest TPTP release (http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/), please re-open.
